alert.note: Alert for Genesee; Northern Erie; Wyoming (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 13 at 2:31PM EDT by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...An area of showers with embedded thunderstorms will impact portions of Wyoming, northeastern Erie and Genesee Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 226 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking an area of showers with embedded strong thunderstorms near Hamburg and moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Buffalo, Cheektowaga, Niagara Falls, West Seneca, North Tonawanda, Clarence, Lackawanna, Batavia, Kenmore, Depew, Amherst, Tonawanda, Lancaster, Williamsville, Darien Lakes State Park, Letchworth State Park, Grand Island, Elma, Pendleton and Marilla. This includes Interstate 90 between exits 47 and 56. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with theses storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
